data.title: OK at best
data.text: After many years of living just a few miles away, we decided to give this place a try .Our waiter seated us very promptly and checked on us all through out our meal.  Our meal was served very quickly and the quality of our meal showed it.  I ordered the street tacos and I was very disappointed.  The chicken was not seasoned at all and each taco was about three bites.  The beans and rice were descent as well as the salsa.  My husband order the fajitas.  While the meat was tender it was not seasoned as well.  We have eaten at a lot of Tex Mex and authentic Mexican restaurants and I can honestly say this was one our least favorite.

data.title: Just a Good Place to Eat
data.text: I have found that they will fix your food any special way you like it if you just ask.  It is better to go for lunch about 1:00 to 1:30 if you want something different when the rush is over.  I like places that understand that each of us have different tastes.

data.title: Just ok
data.text: Indifferent, under-spiced Mexican food, mediocre service.  Tacos are the best thing I've tried.  The enchilladas and breakfast items had very little flavor.  Service is adequate.  If you like mildly flavored Tex-Mex, you'll probably like it.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: Dos Banderas is my favorite local Mexican restaurant.  I eat there almost every Sunday after church.  They have excellent food, service, and atmosphere.  Their prices are also reasonable.  The owner and staff are also very friendly.

data.title: Our goto place.
data.text: We usually eat here for lunch because everyone likes it. Food is good and service is quick. Basic TexMex, large dining room. Chips and salsa are good and fresh. Great for large parties.

data.title: Fave Restaurant
data.text: This is my favorite restaurant by far for Tex Mex or any, for that matter.   GREAT frozen margaritas (not a fan of on the rocks) and always reasonable.   Love the guacamole!  I've been known to go there twice in one week!!

data.title: Food was tasty
data.text: I went to Dos Banderas for dinner with family.  All of our food was served at a great temperature.  I`m allergic to onions and they pleasantly accommodated my food allergy.  Food was freshly made and the staff are very nice.

data.title: Happy at Happy Hour
data.text: I'm in love! Went here with a friend for happy hour and to celebrate her birthday.  Wow! Drinks were awesome and the food was even better. Our waitress was also our bartender and she was Awesome! I'll be back for dinner if not for HH!

data.title: Good food, decent prices, and attentive servers
data.text: The wife and I had to spend a Sunday in Downtown Garland because of church business, so we dropped into Dos Banderas for an early-afternoon snack of nachos. The price was OK, but the food was great and from the way the servers were making sure our drinks were topped off and the chips and salsa replenished you would think we were lottery winners spraying money like it was a firehose.

data.title: Nice Folks,Great Food and Service
data.text:
Have never had a bad experience at this place. I always feel welcomed and always have a hard time not wanting to buy everything on menu.

This 8s one place I hope survives forever!

data.title: Great food
data.text: I've been here several times and I've never been disappointed. I've tried nearly every item on the menu and have enjoyed it all. The bar is also a good place to hang out with friend and family.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: This is one of my go-to Mexican restaurants.  I've never been disappointed and the food, atmosphere, people are wonderful!  They really seem to care that you came in and that you have a good experience.  It's been a while since I've been here, so I need to get there soon!!

data.title: Bargain menu for lunch
data.text: Great lunch menu and good place to eat tex mex.  I've eaten at this place for over 10 years.  It's just a great spot with consistent service and food.

data.title: Our favorite Mexican restaurant
data.text: My hubby and I love going here for our "lunch date".  The food is great and the top shelf margaritas are perfect.  The staff is friendly and efficient, and the atmosphere and ambiance is authentic and relaxing.  Can't be beat for the money.

data.title: Good quick Mexican
data.text: Not much time for lunch today so I gave it a shot. Very good food, friendly wait staff, excellent salsa, and nice atmosphere.

data.title: Cheap and good
data.text: Dos Banderas is a little hole in the wall in downtown Garland. Charming atmosphere and the food is cheap and pretty good.

data.title: Good local Mexican food
data.text: Food and service both good.  Atmosphere typical.  Enjoyed my meal.  I ordered the Enchilada plate with rice.  Chips were fresh.  Salsa great.

data.title: First rate Mexican sit down restaurant downtown Garland
data.text:
Great fiajitas. Large portions. Pretty cheap. I and my family have gone here for years. Check out their website for their menu.
Service was abit lackluster.

data.title: Dos Banderas....again!
data.text: When  we want Mexican food - it's always Dos Banderas !!!  We chow down on their chips and salsa!  Nachos are great!  My husbands favorite is their chicken enchiladas.  We have had chicken enchiladas in every Mexican restaurant in Garland and Dos Banderas makes the best !!  They cook their chicken in spices so it is not bland.  The sauce is tasty too and not bland.  Love 'em!  Our waitress has been there forever and we love her!  Actually, I think she may be a manager now and just comes to our table because she sees us !  Friendly atmosphere. Great Mexican food at a good price,.

data.title: Family Favorite
data.text: We love eating at the local restaurant in our hometown. Dos Banderas is great food and a reasonable price. It is a favorite happy hour spot as well. I enjoy their margaritas at $3 for HH.
